title: Breitbart Texas Articles - Breitbart

organizations.name: texas sheriff vows to help trump deport criminal aliens

text:
In addition to massive security constraints, Super Bowl attendees will also have to face possible disruption of their arrival plans by Black Lives Matter protesters. by Bob Price 5 Feb 2017, 10:15 AM PST 0 
Feb. 5 (UPI) — Two months after his DUI arrest, Michael Floyd is a member of the Super Bowl bound New England Patriots. by UPI 5 Feb 2017, 9:50 AM PST 0 
Feb. 5 (UPI) — All-Pro wide receiver Julio Jones is in no danger of missing Sunday’s Super Bowl, but he’ll need to address his toe this offseason. by UPI 5 Feb 2017, 9:30 AM PST 0 
HOUSTON (AP) — Michael Phelps approaches his Super Bowl pick with equal parts athletic achievement and brand loyalty. by AP 5 Feb 2017, 9:19 AM PST 0 
Houston (AFP) – Atlanta Falcons quarterback Matt Ryan was named the National Football League’s Most Valuable Player, 24 hours before he attempts to crown a superb season with Super Bowl glory. by AFP 5 Feb 2017, 8:52 AM PST 0 
Two previously deported sex offenders were apprehended by Border Patrol agents shortly after they illegally reentered the U.S. from Mexico on Thursday morning. Border Patrol officials stated the arrest illustrates the importance of knowing who is crossing our borders. by Bob Price 5 Feb 2017, 8:12 AM PST 0 
The Texas Attorney General and a Texas county are putting a Mexican national on trial Monday. Her alleged crime: illegally voting in two Texas elections. by Lana Shadwick 5 Feb 2017, 7:55 AM PST 0 GRAPHIC: Key Los Zetas Commander Assassinated in Prison 
A key leader within the Los Zetas cartel was murdered inside the state prison in this city by members of a rival faction of the same cartel. That Zeta commander had been arrested this week in a house tied to the former State Security System. The Tamaulipas Government confirmed to Breitbart Texas that 37-year-old Jose Luis “Comandante Cano” Cano Lumbreras was murdered inside the prison. Cano was returning to his cell from a court hearing when he was attacked by a group of inmates and asphyxiated. by Cartel Chronicles 5 Feb 2017, 7:28 AM PST 0 
A recent border shooting where cartel smugglers fired at U.S. Border Patrol agents points to a disturbing trend as organized crime members appear to be getting more aggressive against law enforcement. by Ildefonso Ortiz 4 Feb 2017, 11:05 AM PST 0 Weird Developments With Special Prosecutors of Texas AG 
The prosecution of Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has taken some weird turns this past week. A court of appeals ordered payments to the special prosecutors stopped, and in an unrelated criminal case, a federal judge removed one of the prosecutors from representing his client, a member of the Bandidos Motorcycle Club, because he had a conflict of interest. by Lana Shadwick 4 Feb 2017, 8:02 AM PST 0 
Another troubled Texas school district surrendered to the state despite an appeal to thwart its takeover and an investigation that revealed internal mismanagement. by Merrill Hope 4 Feb 2017, 7:50 AM PST 0 
Despite the loss of state law enforcement grants, Travis County Sheriff Sally Hernandez followed through and released 39 criminal aliens during the first two days of her sanctuary policy. by Bob Price 4 Feb 2017, 7:24 AM PST 0 Texas Sheriff Vows To Help Trump Deport Criminal Aliens 
A Texas sheriff is looking to aid President Donald Trump’s Department of Homeland Security (DHS) in deporting illegal immigrants through new measures. Tarrant County Sheriff Bill Waybourn announced his department is applying for a federal government-locality agreement known as the by John Binder 4 Feb 2017, 7:04 AM PST 0 Secret Service Puts The Atlantic on Blast for Fake News 
The U.S. Secret Service lashed out at The Atlantic’s Washington editor at large for a series of Tweets officials said were completely false. Steve Clemons, Washington editor at large for The Atlantic, began a series of Tweets on Thursday claiming by Bob Price 3 Feb 2017, 4:14 PM PST 0
